page.title: 05Playground Games in Knowle
page.content: 364 pupils aged between 4 and 11 were interviewed. Several old favourites were still very popular. Football was the most popular (68 children) followed by skipping (37 children) and Tig (31 children). The remaining votes were divided between a number of more obscure games with about 2 or 3 children voting for each eg Kiss Chase. Other games including "Army, Tanks, Trains and Hopscotch". Several children played a "risque" skipping game called Cinderella, which has the following words:"Cinderella, Dressed in yella, Went downstairs, To meet a fella, On her way, Her panties busted, How many people, Were disgusted?". The rope is turned and one child skips throughout the ryhme while the others skip in and out singly counting in 5's. When the rope stops, the game restarts.
